entries.title: The Shifting Landscape of Design
entries.description: The design industry is in a state of flux. The landscape is shifting, and the role of the designer is evolving. The days of the designer as a pixel pusher are long gone. The designer of today is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, and a storyteller. The designer of today is a leader, a collaborator, and a change agent. The designer of today is a business person, a technologist, and a futurist.
entries.alt: Article: The Shifting Landscape of Design

entries.title: Baselines & Design QA: Setting the Foundation for Quality
entries.description: How early baselines make Design QA effortless. When you set design baselines before implementation begins, you prevent problems from taking root. The result? Less testing needed later, fewer discrepancies to catch, and a shared understanding of what 'done' looks like.

entries.title: The Value of Writing
entries.description: What am I trying to say? Do I even have a point?

entries.title: Building My Portfolio: A Design System Playground
entries.description: A living portfolio site that serves as both a showcase and a design system playground. Features a fully-styled markdown renderer, token-based theming with user mode switching, variable font typography, reusable components, and an AI chatbot trained on site content.

entries.title: Designing Genie: Pioneering UX Patterns for Agentic AI
entries.description: An agentic orchestration layer for delivery operations that connects to project ecosystems and continuously synthesizes context, surfaces insights, and automates workflows. Explores three mental model problems in designing for agentic AI: capability exposition, trust & transparency, and autonomy vs. control.
